sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Elias of Evesham OSB, Quadrilogus de uita Sancti Thomae Cantuariensis
Vita S. Thomae
msDesc.p: Vellum, 185 119 , 7.4 x 4.8, ff. 2 + 144 + 4, 25 lines to a page. Cent. xv late?, in a peculiar and pretty hand.
On the last flyleaf (vir): Jacobus Tutyll.

msItem.head: Elias of Evesham OSB, Quadrilogus de uita Sancti Thomae Cantuariensis, 'second' (earlier) version

head.title: Vita S. Thomae archiepiscopi Cantuar. et martyris de plurium narratione collecta

ab.quote: Haec vita, quas in aliis codicibus nominatur quadrilogus sive historia quadripartita, ab annotatore quodam imperito Stephano Cantuariensi attribuitur

msItem.rubric: Uita Sancti Thome de plurium narracione collecta
Incipit prologus in vita Sancti Thome Archiepiscopi Cantuariensis et martiris

ab.decoNote: Handsome initial in gold and colour and partial border of feathery work

msItem.incipit: Post summi fauoris dote uestitos preclaros pugiles
msItem.ab: Robertson, Materials for the History of Archbishop Thomas Becket, IV 266. It is the so-called second quadrilogue by Elias (?) of Evesham
msItem.explicit: virtus et imperium est per infinita secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.rubric: Explicit vita et passio beati thome martiris
msItem.ab: (Robertson, Materials for the History of Archbishop Thomas Becket, IV, p. 408)

ab.handNote: In a hand of cent. xvi

msItem.ab: omnino haec desunt que habentur in libro Willmi Twyne De gestis post martirium, etc. (a list of chapters)

ab.handNote: In another hand of cent. xvi early

msItem.incipit: Inspecta huius operis compilatione in qua vicesimo scilicet primo capite circa finem inveni authorem regias consuetudines scribi in calce huius historie policiturum
